p: As of now, the vast majority of mouse strains used for human HSC engraftment still very much rely upon the mutations and polymorphism described above. The most commonly used strains are the NOD-SCID [ 236, 237, 238], the NOD-SCID-IL2Rγ null (NSG or NOG, harboring a with NOD/LtSz or NOD/Shi background respectively) [ 243, 244, 247], the BALB-c-RAG2 −/−IL2Rγ null (BRG) [ 241, 242, 245] or the NOD- RAG1 −/−IL2Rγ null (NRG) [ 248, 249]. Figure 1 summarizes the development timeline of these models.
